cards.description: Being able to change or be changed depending on circumstances
examples: He showed great ______ and carried out a variety of tasks
The new law gives auto makers more ______ in meeting lower pollution targets

cards.description: The time spent at your job in comparison to the time spent on your personal life
examples: Smart employers know that workers who have a good ______ balance are more dependable, loyal, and productive

cards.description: Something that takes away your attention from something else
examples: Despite these few ______, the collection is a good one
Ideally, visual ______ should be kept to a minimum, but perhaps the most critical factor is the absence of glare

cards.description: Fatigue or tiredness from being overworked
examples: We have found there is much more ______ and sickness among those who don't get help
One possible way forward is the use of clinical supervision as a method of ______ prevention

cards.description: When members of a group have a feeling of belonging and that they matter to one another
examples: More and more research, often quite theoretical, suggests that we must raise the ______ to achieve improvements in the quality of life

cards.description: People you work with
examples: We're having a small drinks party for one of our ______ who's leaving next week
Her work is highly esteemed by all her ______

cards.description: The feeling of friendship and trust that people who work together or spend time together share
examples: When you've been climbing alone for hours, there's a tremendous sense of ______ when you meet another climber
Such team sports fostered male ______ and sociability

cards.description: When people work together to accomplish a goal
examples: Great ______ and old fashioned grit got the team a last minute point
The implications for the development of ______ and leadership are selfevident

cards.description: The feeling or state of being separated from others
examples: The prisoner was kept in ______ for three days
Japan was opened to foreign ideas and culture after 200 years of self-______

cards.description: How much you work you produce in relation to how much time you spend
examples: Studies show that if a working environment is pleasant, ______ increases
______ in the steel industry improved by five percent last year

cards.description: Any location where a person performs a job
examples: The survey asks workers about facilities in their ______
We are trying to eliminate sex discrimination in the ______

cards.description: When an employee works from home rather than an office and uses the phone and/or computer to communication
examples: Most of our employees ______
50,000 of our 130,00 employees ______

cards.description: When someone feels forced or obligated to work exclusively from their desk
The typical hours of work in many countries. Also can mean normal sometimes boring or mundane jobs.
Describes something that allows companies to generate income, fulfill responsibilities and continue to grow
When someone manages a person or department to make sure rules are followed and work is done correctly
examples: She ______ 75 employees in our order department
City schools were placed under state ______ last week

cards.description: Work from both home and office
When you make decisions for yourself without the control of others
examples: The new ______ for our best schools will support innovation and provide an incentive for other schools to improve their performance
In the process, they are gaining economic ______ from men

cards.description: to have formal discussions with someone in order to reach an agreement with them
examples: In my previous job, I ______ client contracts to find a price point that worked best for their needs

cards.description: to watch a person or activity to make certain that everything is done correctly, safely, etc
examples: I ______ a team of 10 product engineers throughout the design and testing phases for prototypes

cards.description: to make many different things work effectively as a whole
examples: I was responsible for ______ department activities in the absence of my direct superior
We need someone to ______ the whole campaign

cards.description: to watch and check something carefully over a period of time
examples: I ______ three of our major accounts to check for transaction errors or outstanding debts
They hired an accountant to help ______ cash flow

cards.description: to be responsible for controlling or organizing someone or something, especially a business or employees
examples: I had the pleasure of ______ the daily activities of 25 employees during my time as a sales manager
Has she had any experience of ______ large projects?

cards.description: to be one of the first people to do something
examples: I ______ a new task delegation system to enhance department productivity by 15%
It was universities that ______ these new industries

cards.description: firm and not changing in your friendship with or support for a person or an organization, or in your belief in your principles
examples: Jack has been a ______ worker in this company for almost 50 years
I would describe myself as a ______ individual who goes above and beyond to help others in the workplace

cards.description: arriving, doing something, or happening at the expected, correct time; not late
examples: I am always ______ whether it's getting to work on-time or meeting deadlines because I have a deep respect for my coworkers and the company I work for

cards.description: to have control and authority over something or someone and the duty of taking care of it, him, or her
examples: In my previous job, I was ______ for handling payroll processing and preparing checks before paydays
Paul is directly responsible for the efficient running of the office

cards.description: able to be reached or easily got
examples: I like to make myself ______ to new employees to help them feel welcomed and supported
The problem with some of these drugs is that they are so very ______

cards.description: always behaving or happening in a similar, especially positive, way
examples: Her work is sometimes good, but the problem is she's not ______
I am a very ______ employee and others can always count on me to hit my quotas and produce quality work

cards.description: telling the truth and able to be trusted
examples: I believe that one of my most marketable qualities is ______. I always respect the privacy of others and I understand how important it is to refrain from speaking about confidential business information

cards.description: If a bank account ______, it contains some money, and if a person or business ______, they have money in the bank and are not in deb
If you or your bank account ______, you owe money to the bank
examples: James expected his furniture company to be operating ______ during its first few months, but he hopes to gain a profit after that initial period

cards.description: To pay unreasonably high prices
examples: If you visit any major city these days, you had better be prepared to ______ for a hotel room

cards.description: Someone who tries to find the best price on the products and services they purchase
examples: A ______ saved 1,400 this week after buying 10,000 second-class stamps ahead of their price hike
But ______ can get gorgeous gifts for bargain prices - here's my guide

cards.description: To take money from one's savings account in small amounts
examples: When my car broke down, I had to ______ to pay for all of the repairs
I had to ______ in order to pay for my vacation

cards.description: To spend a lot of money on buying things, especially things that are pleasant to have but that you do not need
examples: They ______ £3,000 on a holiday
I never had a sense of abundance, of being able to ______ and enjoy myself

cards.description: Short period of time in which someone buys a lot of things
examples: Criminals can use this information to go on a ______ before banks or cardholders realise they are being targeted

cards.description: Reduce the amount or quantity of something, especially expenditure
examples: We’re trying to ______ on the amount we spend on food
It’s time we ______ a little

cards.description: Cheat someone, especially financially
examples: She thought he was ______ her __ over her royalties
They have ______ £6.7 billion

cards.description: If you are ______, you owe money
examples: It was a lovely thought, but I won't ______ to Scrooge, not for baubles
I don't want to ______ to any of my friends

cards.description: Безумие покупок
examples: In an online age, much of yesterday's ______ in America was done from the sofa
With just two weeks to go, the Christmas ______ is in full swing

cards.description: To have no connection with
examples: Long losing runs _____ technical and physical inability
Billy and his father ______ each other for nearly twenty years

cards.description: Cost is higher than it should be or than is reasonable
examples: He sells the shares at an ______ of £6,000
Here, they will sell you tickets at an ______

cards.description: Having or showing shrewdness and good judgment, especially in money or business matters
examples: ______ investors will switch banks if they think they are getting a raw deal
These salesmen are a ______ lot

cards.description: To attract or entice someone or something into some thing, place, or situation
examples: The promise of a big salary isn't going to ______ me __ a job as a corporate slave
The thief tried to ______ the tourist __ an alley to rob him

a body's abnormal reaction to certain foods or environmental substances
the uncontrollable tightening of a muscle
upper front part of the body, between the stomach and the neck, containing the heart and lungs
either of the two soft, rounded parts of a woman's chest that produce milk after she has a baby
the dark part of the skin which sticks out from the breast and through which milk is supplied to the young
the structure of ribs that protects your heart and lungs in your chest
the small round part in the middle of the stomach that is left after the umbilical cord has been cut at birth
the organ in your chest that sends the blood around your body
the red liquid that is sent around the body by the heart
organs in the chest with which people breathe
the line of bones down the centre of the back that provides support for the body and protects the spinal cord
either of the two long parts of the upper body that are attached to the shoulders and have the hands at the end
part of the body that join the arms to the rest of the body
the hollow place under your arm where your arm joins your body
the large muscle at the back of the upper arm
the large muscle at the front of the upper arm
the part in the middle of the arm where it bends, or the part of a piece of clothing that covers this area
the part of the body between the hand and the arm
the lower part of the arm, between the wrist and the elbow
the part of the body at the end of the arm that is used for holding, moving, touching, and feeling things
any of the long, thin, separate parts of the hand, especially those that are not thumbs
the short, thick finger on the side of your hand that makes it possible to hold and pick things up easily
the inside part of your hand from your wrist to the base of your fingers
the hard, slightly curved part that covers and protects the top of the end of a finger
an organ in the body where food is digested, or the soft front part of your body just below the chest
the part of the body above and slightly narrower than the hips
the area below the waist and above the legs at either side of the body, or the joint that connects the leg to the upper part of the body
the part of a male's body that is used for urinating and for sex
the part of a woman's body that connects her outer sex organs to her uterus
the part of the body that you sit on
a long tube through which food travels while it is being digested after leaving the stomach
an organ like a bag inside the body of a person or animal, where urine is stored before it leaves the body
a large organ in the body that cleans the blood and produces bile
either of a pair of small organs in the body that take away waste matter from the blood to produce urine
the organ in the body of a woman in which a baby develops before birth
the part of a person's leg above the knee
the front part of your leg between your knee and your foot
the thick curved part at the back of the human leg between the knee and the foot
the joint between the foot and the leg, or the thin part of the leg just above the foot
the part of the body at the bottom of the leg on which a person stands
any of the five separate parts at the end of the foot
the middle joint of the leg that allows the leg to bend
one of the parts of the body that is used for standing or walking
the rounded back part of the foot
the part of the body that joins the head to the shoulders
the part of the body above the neck where the eyes, nose, mouth, ears, and brain are
the organ inside the head that controls thought, memory, feelings, and activity
the skin on the top of a person's head where hair usually grows
organs in your face that are used for seeing
the soft part of your face that is below your eye and between your mouth and ear
white objects in the mouth that are used for biting and chewing
soft parts that form the upper and lower edges of the mouth
the part of a person's face below their mouth
the part of the face that sticks out above the mouth, through which you breathe and smell
organs by which people or animals hear sounds
the mass of thin thread-like structures on the head of a person
the line of short hairs above each eye in humans
the opening in the face, consisting of the lips and the space between them
the lower part of your face that moves when you open your mouth
the flat part of the face, above the eyes and below the hair
the large, soft piece of flesh in the mouth that you can move, and is used for tasting, speaking, etc.
the front of the neck, or the space inside the neck down which food and air can go
Room in the roof space of a house (could be lived in)
a room in which meals are eaten
A room used for sleeping in
The room in a house or apartment that is used for relaxing, and entertaining guests, but not usually for eating
A room with a bath and/or shower and often a toilet
The area just inside the main entrance of a house, apartment or other building which leads to other rooms and usually to the stairs
Usually just for washing machine, freezer etc
A separated building from the house usually for storing garden tools
Space in the roof of the house usually used only for storage
Room below ground level without any windows used for storage
Room below ground level, with windows, used for living and working
Covered area before the entrance door
Paved area between the house and garden for sitting and eating, etc
an area with a wall or bars around it that is joined to the outside wall of a building on an upper level
A building which people, usually one family, live in
Describes a house that is not connected to any other building
A house that is semi-detached is one that is joined to another similar house on only one side
A set of rooms for living in, especially on one floor of a building
A small house, usually in the countryside
A house that has only one story/floor
a fixed receptacle into which a person may urinate or defecate, typically consisting of a large bowl connected to a system for flushing away the waste into a sewer or septic tank
examples: Liz heard the toilet flush

a bowl that is attached to the wall in a kitchen or bathroom in which you wash dishes or your hands, etc
examples: You'll need a strong abrasive for cleaning this ______

cards.description: a piece of cloth or paper used for drying someone or something that is wet
examples: She came downstairs after her shower, wrapped in a ______
He used a paper ______ to mop up the spill

cards.description: soft paper, usually in a long roll, used to clean yourself when you have used the toilet
a substance used for washing the body or other things
examples: This ______ is kinder to the skin
There was no ______, so I just rinsed my hands with water

cards.description: a brush used for making the hair on your head neat and smooth
a strip of plastic, metal, or wood with a row of narrow teeth, used for untangling or arranging the hair
a brush with a long handle that is used to clean the inside of a toilet
a suction device consisting of a cup-shaped piece of rubber on the end of a stick, used to get rid of things that are blocking pipes
a paste used on a toothbrush for cleaning the teeth.
a small brush with a long handle, used for cleaning the teeth
an electrical device for drying a person's hair by blowing warm air over it
a liquid preparation containing detergent or soap for washing the hair
a powder used in a washing machine to wash clothes
a machine for washing clothes, sheets, and other things made of cloth
a liquid used in a washing machine to wash clothes:
a small device with a sharp blade for removing hair, especially from the face or legs
a brand name for a short stick with a small amount of cotton on each end that is used for cleaning, especially the ears
a device for weighing things or people
examples: Her last baby tipped the ______ at ten pounds
She weighs herself every week on the ______ in the bathroom

cards.description: emergency vehicle that rushes people to a hospital
objects that people with injured legs or feet use to help them walk
a medical disorder that is harmful to a person's health
medical background of a person's family members
a place where people go to buy medication and other medical supplies
the correct amount and type of medication needed to cure an illness or relieve symptoms
a doctor's appointment to check a person's general health
a chair on wheels used for transporting patients from place to place
